intro: Calobota cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf calobota, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Calobota cinerea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
